hmmm, that might be.... too much https://t.co/AiLtBtReeb

I have also spent a lot of time refining my interactions with co-pilot, and now my files are structured and commented in a way that lets the robot have enough context to what I am trying to accomplish that it can give me good suggestions, that doubles as easily-readable code too

Getting to that place took years and was a very personal process, and required a lot of soul searching when the technologies that made me work faster were often not the first choices for clients or collaborators, but if you take my tools away I lose my “superpower”

When I start a project now, I do not think about: file naming, file structure, how to get the data, hosting, what libraries to use– what I do think about is: who is this useful for, what will make this easier to understand, how can I add delight and joy— you know, “coding”

Another crucial part of building things quickly is that you are also building the developer experience of the person who has to pick up this prototype and live with it as a product– decisions made for speed often come at the cost of longevity– but it doesn’t have to!

The purpose of this speed for me is to Do More and Learn More, which comes from accelerated failing; prototyping. I want to make more things with more people, and to do that I need to bring the time cost as close to zero as possible, while still using resilient production tech

This probably makes the whole process 1.25x faster, having the right tools that are easy and fast to spin up probably gets me another speed boost, memorizing the names of the incantations within d3 (groups and scales, mostly) saves a bit of time too

With co-pilot this process is a lot less like “coding” and a lot more like directing, in that I arrange a toolset (vue, d3, turf) and data, describe that data in a way a robot can understand, and vaguely gesture at the desired behavior I want, prompting The Robot to code
Truly there is magic in the moments between “that would be cool” and “we have a hosted webapp that can do 80% of that” and I am trying to bring that space down to, like, minutes if I can

Degit clone the template, arrange file structure, grab data (csv/json/spin up datasette API), visualize data with v-fors and light Plots, push draft to Netlify, share with client+designers, get feedback, grab more data, visualize with D3/maps, add more controls, push to Netlify,,
I spin up new Nuxt/Vue apps at a truly alarming rate lately, I cannot be stopped
https://t.co/amjGD3RLcd
